result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven R. Bembenek

records.addlTxt:
2:24 PM/ RM 301.  Defendant Steven R. Bembenek in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. is still waiting for counsel. State notes status of counsel report and requests adjourned initial appearance at a later date. Bond remains.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:21 PM Defendant Steven R. Bembenek in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history and appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court questions if Def. would like to go past time limits for P.H. Def. would like to waive time limits and wait for counsel. Court finds good cause and feels Def. should have counsel. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:37 PM Defendant Steven R. Bembenek in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin., via zoom. Court notes history of case.  Court notes counsel report.  Def. still wants to wait.  Court finds def. needs counsel and finds good cause to go past time limits for P.H. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:54 PM Defendant Steven R. Bembenek in court.  Attorney Kelly L. Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. has applied with PD office and has not yet received counsel. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court agrees and finds good cause to go past time limits.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:44 PM Defendant Steven R. Bembenek in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Def. is still waiting for counsel. Court reviews history of case. Def. contacted PD today. Motion to modify bond filed and will need to get scheduled. Victim rights not a issue. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No contact with co defendant Brittany Marvin

1:27 PM Defendant Steven R. Bembenek appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. heard on rights and atty rights.  Court continues with charges and rights.  State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with co defendant Brittany Marvin. Def. heard on bond. Court orders $5,000 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with co defendant Brittany Marvin. Court will reserve right to be  heard on bond @ later date.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
